subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... I have one test case in XOM that parses a several *gigabyte* sized file. The test is testing precisely that XOM can handle a several gigabyte sized file.
messageBody:
Robert Wenner wrote:

> Hint: cut it down to simpler XML.
> I cannot believe you have no duplication in terms of features in a several
> megabytes file.

I have one test case in XOM that parses a several *gigabyte* sized file.
The test is testing precisely that XOM can handle a several gigabyte
sized file. i.e. it's testing that XOM isn't unnecessarily holding
references to things it shouldn't be holding references to more than
it's testing any specific part of the parsing process.

--
Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
XML in a Nutshell 3rd Edition Just Published!
http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/xian3/
